comments.body: We don't have agreed-upon principles about when a command group that doesn't start with a verb is appropriate vs. not.
Ah, I see this point isn't new. Nevermind.

We should add a note that new command groups should not be added lightly - they need to clearly derive from a need to reduce top level complexity and group related, but not identical commands over a problem domain.  Command groups are used when the structure of the sub commands justifies a new-top level binary (kubeadm) but it is not clear that the grouping would be desired.

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +70,74 @@  * Ideally, commonly needed functionality would be implemented server-side in order to avoid problems typical of "fat" clients and to make it readily available to non-Go clients.
* Commands that generate resources, such as `run` or `expose`, should obey specific conventions, see [generators](#generators).
* A command group (e.g., `kubectl config`) may be used to group related non-standard commands, such as custom generators, mutations, and computations.
